original_title: Hackaday Podcast Episode 261: Rickroll Toothbrush, Keyboard Cat, Zombie Dialup
original_content:
This week, Editor-in-Chief Elliot Williams and Kristina Panos met up in a new disposable location to give the lowdown on this weeks best hacks. First up in the news  the Home Sweet Home Automation contest is still going strong. Youve still got plenty of time, so get on over to Hackaday.IO and start your entry today. In the news, the UK is asking how powerful an electric bike should be (more than 250 Watts, certainly), and legal pressure from Nintendo has shut down two emulators.




Then its on to Whats That Sound. Kristina failed again, although she was pretty confident about her answer. Can you get it? Can you figure it out? Can you guess whats making that sound this week? If you can, and your number comes up, you get a special Hackaday Podcast t-shirt.
But then its on to the hacks, beginning with a Wi-Fi toothbrush hack from [Aaron Christophel]. This can only mean the beginning of some epic toothbrush firmware, right? From there, we marvel at moving cat food, the ultimate bulk material, and the idea of spoofing a whole cloud of drones. Finally, we examine one of Jennys Daily Drivers in the form of Damn Small Linux (the other DSL), and reminisce about dial-up (speaking of DSL).
Check out the links below if you want to follow along, and as always, tell us what you think about this episode in the comments!

Download and savor at your leisure.

title: ハックadayホームオートメーションコンテスト始動！
body: Editor-in-Chief Elliot WilliamsとKristina Panosが一週間のハックについて話し合う。Home Sweet Home Automationコンテストはまだ続行中。UKでは電動自転車のパワーについて討論。また、ニンテンドーからの法的圧力によりエミュレータが停止。
titles: ハックadayホームオートメーションコンテスト始動！
UKが問う電動自転車の出力制限
ニンテンドーによるエミュレーターのシャットダウン
ドローンのIDをスプーフィングして位置情報を非表示
